title: Reinstating Commonsense School Discipline Policies
summary:
The document outlines Executive Order 14280, issued on April 23, 2025, which reinstates commonsense school discipline policies aimed at ensuring safety and order in American classrooms. The order criticizes previous policies, particularly a 2014 Dear Colleague letter from the Department of Education and Department of Justice, which imposed a disparate-impact framework that allegedly led to racial discrimination in school discipline. The order cites a 2018 Federal Commission on School Safety report indicating that such policies resulted in unaddressed student misconduct, leading to increased classroom disorder and violence.

Key findings include:
- The 2014 guidance was rescinded in 2018 but was effectively reinstated in 2023, prompting concerns about the weaponization of Title VI of the Civil Rights Act to enforce discriminatory discipline practices.
- The order mandates the Secretary of Education to provide new guidance to local educational agencies to ensure compliance with Title VI and to prevent racial discrimination in school discipline.
- A series of actions are outlined, including assessments of discipline-related policies and recommendations to eliminate the promotion of discriminatory equity ideology in education.

The implications of this order suggest a significant shift back toward traditional discipline practices that prioritize student behavior over racial statistics, aiming to enhance safety and educational outcomes in schools.
